title: Calories in a Tilapia Fillet
meta_description: Discover calories in a tilapia fillet (about 100g cooked), including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Cooked tilapia fillet (baked or grilled), skinless and boneless; standard fillet size ~100g (3.5 oz).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by fish size, farming method, cooking technique, and added seasonings; consult fresh labels or databases for precision.

quick_answer.text: A 100g cooked tilapia fillet provides ~128 kcal and ~26g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged fish.

tweaks.label: Pan-fried with 1 tsp oil per fillet

faqs.q: How many calories in a tilapia fillet?
faqs.a: About 128 kcal for a 100g cooked, skinless tilapia fillet.
Yes, one 100g fillet has ~26g protein, making it a lean source.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in tilapia?
faqs.a: Baking or grilling keeps it low-cal; frying adds ~40 kcal from oil.
Tilapia has 0g carbs, fiber, and sugars per 100gâ€”pure protein and fat.

faqs.q: How does tilapia compare to other fish nutritionally?
faqs.a: Similar to cod or sole: low fat (2.7g/100g), low calories, high protein; cholesterol ~57mg.
